position.marginalia_text: (8) Ostrick Drum to beat a march

substitution.copyText: Ham. The point envenom d too, then venom to thy work. All. Treason, treason.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. The point envenom d too? then venom to thy work. [Ost: deleted]

substitution.copyText: Ham. Here thou incestuous Dane, | " Drink off this potion is the Onyx here? | Follow my mother.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. Here thou incestuous Dane, | Follow my mother.

substitution.copyText: Laert. " He is justly serv'd, it is a poison temper'd by himself.
Ham. Heaven make thee free of it I follow thee, | I am dead Horatio, wretched Queen farewel.
substitution.amendedText: Ham. Heaven make thee free of it! I follow thee: | wretched Queen, farewel!

substitution.copyText: Had I but time (as this fell Sergeant Death | Is strict in his arrest) O I could tell you; | But let it be: Horatio I am dead,
substitution.amendedText: Had I but time (as this fell Sergeant Death | Is strict in his arrest) O I could tell you;-- | But let it be-Horatio

substitution.copyText: Ham. As th'art a man | Give me the cup, let go, I'll have't: O Horatio what a wounded name, | Things standing thus unknown, shall I leave behind me?
substitution.amendedText: Ham. As th'art a man | Give me the cup; let go; I'll have't: O good Horatio what a wounded name, | Things standing thus unknown, shall live behind me?

substitution.copyText: Ostr. Young Fortinbrass with conquest come from Poland, | Th' Embassadors of England give this warlike volley.
substitution.amendedText: Ostr. Young Fortinbrass with conquest come from Poland, | To the Embassadors of England gives this warlike volley.

substitution.copyText: Ham. O I die Horatio, | The potent poison quite o'regrows my spirit; | I cannot live to hear the news from England, | But I do prophesie the election lights
substitution.amendedText: Ham. O I die, Horatio; | The potent poison quite o'regrows my spirit; | I cannot live to hear the news from England. | But I do prophesie, the election lights
